DataElement.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Disease Response Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the acute myeloid leukemia disease response status based on morphological evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Disease Response Evaluation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification)._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

Property.preferredDefinition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: Princess Margaret Cancer Centre, Toronto, ON

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

PermissibleValues.value: Complete remission with Incomplete Platelet Recovery (CRp)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Remission With Incomplete Platelet Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Remission With Incomplete Platelet Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes: A getting back or regaining.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes.
A getting back or regaining.

PermissibleValues.value: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery (CRi)
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

Concepts.longName: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of leukemia in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all cells with morphologic characteristics of leukemia, accompanied by bone marrow recovery, in response to treatment. Hematologic recovery is not required. Leukemia free state can be a hypocellular marrow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease that resists treatment.

Concepts.definition: A disease that resists treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Molecular Relapse Post Minimal Residual Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Molecular Relapse Post Minimal Residual Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or produced by or consisting of molecules.
The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Hematologic Relapse Post Complete Remission Minimal Residual Disease Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hematologic Relapse Post Complete Remission Minimal Residual Disease Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.: Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.
Evidence for remaining tumor following primary treatment that is only apparent using highly sensitive techniques.

Concepts.longName: Complete Remission with Incomplete Hematological Recovery
Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of leukemia in response to treatment with residual neutropenia (less than 1,000 per microliter), with or without complete platelet recovery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death resulting from an unknown cause.

Concepts.definition: Death resulting from an unknown cause.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Death in aplasia
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: A disease that resists treatment.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
A disease that resists treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

Concepts.definition: An effect of a therapeutic intervention that prolongs life, improves function, and/or improves the way a subject feels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.: A condition superior to an earlier condition.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
A condition superior to an earlier condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.: An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine): remainder of a tumor or a neoplasm/cancer after primary, potentially curative therapy.

Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
